Authors:
Jamjan Meeboon, iman - hidayat, Kartini Kramadibrata, Dian
Nurcahyanto, Siska Arie Siahaan, Susumu Takamatsu
Title:
Cystotheca tjibodensis (Erysiphaceae, Ascomycota): Ninety
years rediscovery in Java and first finding of anamorph
Keywords:
rDNA ITS sequence, Lanomyces, powdery mildew, taxonomy,
Indonesia
Abstract:
Cystotheca tjibodensis (GÃ¤um) Katumoto, formery known as
Lanomyces tjibodensis (Perisporiales), is a fungus found in 1920 in
Indonesia. This fungus has been known only by the type specimen, and is
now regarded as a species of the Erysiphales. However, molecular data
are still required to verify the taxonomic treatment. In March 2011 we
rediscovered the fungus at Cibodas Botanical Garden, Java. Detailed
characterizations of this tropical powdery mildew are reported in this
study with both morphological and molecular bases. Anamorph of this
fungus that was not found in the type specimen is also reported in this
study.
